definition: to kick one's legs/leg press (exercise)/(coll.) to kick the bucket
to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]

sentences.english: The unique part about the breaststroke kick is the combination of flexibility and the combination of strength.
sentences.chinese: 靈活性和力量的結合是蛙泳蹬腿獨特的部分。

sentences.english: Then father told me how to move, how to stretch out my hands and legs.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸告訴我應該怎麼動，怎樣伸手蹬腿。

sentences.english: In fast, shallow water, swim on your back, feet first.
sentences.chinese: 在淺而急的水中，要用仰泳，先蹬腿。

sentences.english: I thought the oldest were going to peg out.
sentences.chinese: 我想最老的那些人快蹬腿了。

sentences.english: Watch the tiles and adjust your kick so that the tiles keep whizzing by you.
sentences.chinese: 看着磁磚，調整你的蹬腿使瓷磚持續地掠過。

definition: to sway one's hips/to twist one's waist
to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
to hop/to jump on one leg
to feel suffocated or oppressed/to choke with resentment/to feel injured or resentful
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
